title: Thomas J. Butler Memorial Scholarship
Fields of Study:: Criminal Justice, Political Science, Public Service, Social Services
Description:: The Thomas J. Butler Memorial Scholarship is open to students who are residents of South Boston.  You must be a graduating high school senior, have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and demonstrate an interest in pursuing studies in criminal justice, political science, public service or social services in order to be considered for this award.

title: Donna Rauseo Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Donna Rauseo Memorial Scholarship is open to female students who are residents of East Boston.  You must be a graduating high school senior, have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and be involved in community service in order to be considered for this award.

title: Lowell L. Richards III Memorial Scholarship
Fields of Study:: Government, Public Administration, Management, Planning, Architecture, Design
Description:: The Lowell L. Richards III Memorial Scholarship is open to students who are residents of Boston, Chelsea, Revere or Winthrop.  You must be a graduating high school senior, have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and be interesting in pursuing studies in government, public administration, management, planning, architecture or design in order to be considered for this award.

title: Diversity STEM Scholarship
Fields of Study:: STEM Fields, Aviation, Business Administration, Accounting, Architecture, Engineering, Finance, Human Resources
Description::
The Diversity STEM Scholarship is open to  minority students who are residents of East Boston, South Boston, Chelsea, Charlestown,
Winthrop, Revere, Worcester, Lexington, Lincoln, Concord or Bedford.  You must be a graduating high school senior, have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and be interesting in pursuing studies that would be utilized in the transportation industry in order to be considered for this award.

title: $2,500 Christian College Scholarship Drawing
Description:: Request Christian college information and enter our $2,500 annual Christian college scholarship drawing.  The winner may use the scholarship to attend any Christian college in the U.S. or Canada.

title: $5,000 Course Hero Monthly Scholarship
Description:: Get up to $5,000 in just 3-steps! Winners will be chosen based on a 200 word, short-answer response, so be creative!

title: Mustang Scholars Program
Description:: The Mustang Scholars Program is open to entering freshmen at Southern Methodist University.  You must graduating from a DISD high school to be eligible for this award.

title: Story of the Year Contest
Description:: The Story of the Year Contest is open to students who are residents of the U.S.  You must submit an original story of between 1,000 and 10,000 words in one of the following categories: Diversity, Historical Fiction, Fantasy, Horror/Suspense or Teens by Teens in order to be considered for this award.

title: GEAR UP Idaho Scholarship
Description:: The GEAR UP Idaho Scholarship is open to high school seniors graduating from a high school in Idaho.  You must have been a participant in the early intervention component of the GEAR UP program, be less than 22 years of age and plan to enroll at one of the selected Idaho colleges in order to be considered for this award.

title: Oktoberfest $1,000 Scholarship
Description:: You'll want to don your lederhosen and get ready for several weeks of fun if you win this $1,000 scholarship. Spend as many points as you want on the $1,000 Oktoberfest Scholarship drawing before midnight Pacific on September 30, 2016. The more points you spend, the more chances you'll have to win -- thanks to your ScholarshipPoints.com membership. The winner will be announced on October 3, 2016.

title: Cheeseburger Heaven $1,000 Scholarship
Description:: September 18th is National Cheeseburger Day. What would be a better way to commemorate this staple of many college student diets than with this $1,000 scholarship? Spend as many points as you want on the $1,000 Cheeseburger Heaven Scholarship drawing before midnight Pacific on September 30, 2016. The more points you spend, the more chances you'll have to win -- thanks to your ScholarshipPoints.com membership. The winner will be announced on October 3, 2016.

title: Saver's Scholarship
Description:: The Saver's Scholarship is open to students at Washington College.  The college will match the amount you and your family have saved in a 529 college savings plan or Educational Savings Account.  You must complete the FAFSA by March 1 in order to be considered for this award.

title: $1000 Market Research Scholarship
Description:: Massfinity will award $1,000 to one lucky user who joins our partner site, Harris Poll Online.  By completing the one-page sign up form (basic information and it’s free!), you’ll enter in for a chance to win the $1,000 Market Research Scholarship automatically.  It’s the easiest scholarship application you’ll ever fill out.  AND we only use your information to email you unique survey opportunities, like what you think about student loans, or where you want to work after school ends.  We need student opinions on world issues, and we’re looking for more students to join our site.  Join Harris Poll Online today for free to enter in for a chance to win a $1,000 check, and start receiving awesome online surveys today.

title: $5,000 Easy Scholarship: Use Your Phone to Unlock a Donation to a Classroom in Need!
Description:: Help fund a classroom in need by playing fun mystery game about science and math! By playing and sharing the game on your phone, you’ll help fund a classroom by unlocking a real donation by The 3M Company. Plus, you’ll automatically enter to win a $5,000 scholarship. Yep, it’s that easy (and fun)!

title: $5,000 Easy Scholarship: Help One Friend Register to Vote!
Description:: Each time you share a unique registration link, you will receive one scholarship entry. Unlimited entries. No minimum GPA or essays required. Must be 13 to 25 years old to apply. This scholarship is only open to those residing in the U.S. and Canada or those who hold citizenship in the U.S. or Canada.

title: $1,000 Easy Scholarship: Help Make Your School More Fair
Description:: Spotting hidden inequalities in your school and making it more fair is hard, we totally get that. But we can help you! Sign up through the link and enter to win a $1,000 scholarship.

title: $1,000 Easy Scholarship: Make a Poster to Help Kids Learn Their ABCs!
Description:: You could win an easy $1,000 scholarship just by making an ABCs poster for a kindergarten classroom. That’ll increase students’ literacy and the likelihood they’ll go to college! Plus, you’ll automatically enter to win a $1,000 scholarship. Win-win!

Provided By:: Southeast Missouri State University - General Scholarships
title: Donald (Diz) Anderson Student-Athlete Scholarship
Description:: The Donald (Diz) Anderson Student-Athlete Scholarship is available to students at Southeast Missouri State University.  You must be a member of the football team and be in good academic standing to be eligible for this award.

Provided By:: Southeast Missouri State University - General Scholarships
title: Dr. Morton B. Harris Scholarship
Description:: The Dr. Morton B. Harris Scholarship is available to student athletes at Southeast Missouri State University.  You must demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award.

title: City of Chicago Scholarship
Description:: The City of Chicago Scholarship is available to students who are dependents of current or retired employees of the City of Chicago and its sister agencies.  You must have a minimum 2.5 GPA to be eligible for this award.

Provided By:: Asia SiVon Cottom Memorial Scholarship Fund
title: Asia SiVon Cottom Scholarship
Description::
The Asia SiVon Cottom Scholarship is available to high school seniors, undergraduate, and graduate students.  You must be pursuing a degree in science, technology, engineering, or math to be eligible for this award.  You must also submit a minimum 300 - word essay on the effects and aftermath of September 11th on today's
society, what you plan to achieve through college that can possibly impact the community and / or the world, and why you should receive a Memorial Scholarship.

title: ScholarshipPoints $10,000 Scholarship
Description:: ScholarshipPoints will award a $10,000 scholarship to one lucky member this quarter. All you have to do to become eligible is become a ScholarshipPoints member and log in. It's simple, fun, and completely free!

title: $1,000 Easy Scholarship: Protect Elephants With One Simple Click!
Description:: 96 African elephants are killed by poachers every single day, which means these amazing animals could be extinct by 2025. You could win an easy $1,000 scholarship just by clicking a button to flag ivory products on Craigslist! It’s a super easy way to take down poachers and enter to win a $1,000 scholarship.

title: $1,500 Easy Scholarship: Help Your Friends Reduce Stress
Description:: You could win an easy $1,500 scholarship by helping your friends reduce stress in two easy steps. Step 1) Take a picture of what you look like when you’re stressed (your #SuperStressFace!). Step 2) Share it with friends on social media with one of our tips proven to help de-stress! That’ll help make back-to-school easier for your friends and automatically enter you to win a $1,500 scholarship!

title: Course Hero $5,000 Fall Scholarship
Description:: Course Hero will post one question online each month and allow registered, eligible entrants up to 150 words to submit a response. Each month, Course Hero will select one winner with the best response from among all Contest entrants. This month’s Contest winner will receive a $5,000 Scholarship, depending on such winner’s eligibility category.

title: $1,000 October Scholarship
Description:: Each new school year is an opportunity for a fresh start, so we're giving away a $1,000 scholarship to help kickoff the new school year.
